page.title: 11A Tour of Esholt (cont.)
page.content: audience to sit.In the hall there are pictures of the characters of the programme. Next we went to the graveyard,which is near the institute and the pub,up the path next to the church.there were about 80 graves.The newest was 1984 and the oldest 1901,where the man concerned had died at sea.The church was founded in 1776.It was built of stone with stained glass windows.The stone was beautifully carved.The grounds of the church were overgrown but some of the graves were well kept by their families.Most of the graves were from the turn of the century around 1905 but some were more recent. Some graves could hardly be seen because the grass was so high.Most of the stones were eroded,making it difficult to read them.The ages at death varied from 96 to a few months.
